body:
:+1: here.

I think this might dovetail with the still-really-need-time-to-implement-it #387 and/or #50. I.e. a cleaner, user-facing API for configuring supported ciphers and key types (at the _very_ least, honoring the `ssh_config` bits for same, which I don't think we do yet.)

Put another way, I'd love to change the default like OpenSSH 7 did, but only once there is an easy way for users on legacy platforms to change it back.

issue.title: Removed support for hmac-md5 and truncated hmac-sha1

repository.name: paramiko-ng
repository.description: A fork of Paramiko - The Python SSHv2 protocol library

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1

issue.body:
These are being removed from OpenSSH as well:
https://github.com/openssh/openssh-portable/commit/714e367226ded4dc3897078be48b961637350b05

port of https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/pull/688

body:
Dang I thought this issue was gonna be a lot newer, have only really been thinking about it since a year or two ago when OpenSSH started making noises about completely removing DSA.

At this point in time, I think I'm happy just nuking DSA right off as a "less code to maintain" cleanup action, though I'll still mark the release as major to signal the backwards incompatibility for any poor sods using Paramiko to eg talk to incredibly old and busted vendor hardware or suchlike.

So far what I'm roughly doing as I remove:
- regular code, straight removal of all mentions of DSS/DSA, unless part of ECDSA context obviously.
- in docstrings etc I'm typically opting to replace very old "RSA or DSA" references with just "key types" generically
- in tests:
  - standalone cases (including list members in tests which iterate over a list of key types or identifiers) concerned solely with DSA, which have RSA or etc equivalents nearby: nuking
  - standalone cases where DSA is the only key used (due to age, usually): replace with RSA for expediency
  - cases involving both RSA and DSA: replace the DSA with Ed25519
Will release this as 4.0.0, probably next weekend, I think it'd be nice to work a (planned for a while) packaging metadata refresh into such a release.

issue.title: Paramiko 4.0.0 breaks sftpretty init

repository.name: sftpretty
repository.description: Provides multi-threaded routines and high level protocol abstractions for a pretty quick & simple file transfer experience. Super duper close to a drop in replacement for pysftp.

issue.body:
Hi,

First off, thank you for a great library! I'm creating an issue instead of a PR since I have no idea of the project standards/goals/directions. 

paramiko 4.0.0 was just released, and has [dropped support from DSA/DSS keys](https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/issues/973).

This breaks sftpretty's init [[1](https://github.com/byteskeptical/sftpretty/blob/b5555a7ec9276078bef6d2a7caffd13c22e3f501/sftpretty/__init__.py#L9)] (can also see dss references [2](https://github.com/byteskeptical/sftpretty/blob/b5555a7ec9276078bef6d2a7caffd13c22e3f501/sftpretty/__init__.py#L79C32-L79C36), [3](https://github.com/byteskeptical/sftpretty/blob/b5555a7ec9276078bef6d2a7caffd13c22e3f501/sftpretty/__init__.py#L209)).

This could be hotfixed by modifying pyproject dependency [line](https://github.com/byteskeptical/sftpretty/blob/b5555a7ec9276078bef6d2a7caffd13c22e3f501/pyproject.toml#L28) to `'paramiko>=2.7.0,<4.0.0'`.

Removal of DSS support from future versions seems the only way to keep using the latest versions of paramiko.

Thank you!

issue.title: [BUG] - ImportError: Cannot import name 'DSSKey' from 'paramiko'

repository.name: paramiko
repository.description: The leading native Python SSHv2 protocol library.

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1

issue.body:
### Are you using paramiko as a client or server?

Client

### What feature(s) aren't working right?

Keys/auth

### What version(s) of paramiko are you using?

4.0.0

### What version(s) of Python are you using?

3.9

### What operating system and version are you using?

Ubuntu 20.04

### If you're connecting as a client, which SSH server are you connecting to?

MFT

### If you're using paramiko as part of another tool, which tool/version?

pysftp v0.29

### Expected/desired behavior

Perform a simple file transfer (PUT) to a MFT server over SFTP. We are using `pysftp` library, a wrapper of `paramiko`. 

### Actual behavior

The transfer fails at the very beggining with "ImportError: cannot import name 'DSSKey' from 'paramiko'". 

Here is the traceback:
```python
/local_disk0/.ephemeral_nfs/cluster_libraries/python/lib/python3.9/site-packages/pysftp/__init__.py in <module>
     12 import paramiko
     13 from paramiko import SSHException, AuthenticationException   # make available
---> 14 from paramiko import AgentKey, RSAKey, DSSKey
     15 
     16 from pysftp.exceptions import (CredentialException, ConnectionException,

ImportError: cannot import name 'DSSKey' from 'paramiko' (/local_disk0/.ephemeral_nfs/cluster_libraries/python/lib/python3.9/site-packages/paramiko/__init__.py)
```

### How to reproduce

```python
import pysftp

cnopts = pysftp.CnOpts()
cnopts.hostkeys = None

# Connect to the SFTP server and upload the file
with pysftp.Connection(
    sftp_host, port=sftp_port, username=sftp_username, password=sftp_password, cnopts=cnopts
) as sftp:
    sftp.put(local_path, sftp_remote_path)
```

### Anything else?

This process started failing today around 01.00 UTC at the time the new `paramiko` version was released.

issue.title: fix(deps): Constrain paramiko version to <4
issue.body:
Version 4.0.0 of paramiko has just been released which [drops support for DSA keys](https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/issues/973), resulting in the following error when using `tap-mysql`:

```
  File "/root/.local/pipx/venvs/meltanolabs-tap-mysql/lib/python3.11/site-packages/tap_mysql/tap.py", line 255, in guess_key_type
    paramiko.DSSKey,
    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
AttributeError: module 'paramiko' has no attribute 'DSSKey'. Did you mean: 'RSAKey'?
```

This PR locks paramiko to <4.0.0, avoiding the issue.

issue.title: Replace unmaintained `pysftp` dependency

repository.name: thoth-dissemination
repository.description: Dissemination of work metadata and files from Thoth to distribution/archiving platforms

issue.body:
`pysftp` has been unmaintained since 2016 and general advice is to switch it out for a replacement SFTP package. `pysftp` is a high-level wrapper around `paramiko`, and `paramiko` docs recommend using `fabric` if you only need to use high-level functions.

`pysftp` has the dependency `paramiko>=1.17.0`, which can cause sudden behaviour changes when new versions of `paramiko` are released. For example, a [breaking change](https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/issues/973) in `paramiko 4.0.0` caused workflow runs to start failing with an import error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/home/runner/work/-dissemination/-dissemination/disseminator.py", line 18, in <module>
from souploader import SOUploader
File "/home/runner/work/-dissemination/-dissemination/souploader.py", line 8, in <module>
import pysftp
File "/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.11.13/x64/lib/python3.11/site-packages/pysftp/init.py", line 14, in <module>
from paramiko import AgentKey, RSAKey, DSSKey
ImportError: cannot import name 'DSSKey' from 'paramiko' (/opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.11.13/x64/lib/python3.11/site-packages/paramiko/init.py)
```

This was worked around by pinning the `paramiko` version under dfe5079, to fix the immediate problem of workflows being unusable, but we should avoid relying on outdated packages.

issue.title: Remove support for DSA (aka DSS) key algorithm
issue.body:
To remain compatible with Paramiko, support for DSA key algo should be removed, i.e., on this line:
https://github.com/pahaz/sshtunnel/blob/aa7342e55e49529fea020a09ba8f1eed33eb896f/sshtunnel.py#L1093

Paramiko changelog (https://www.paramiko.org/changelog.html):
> [Support] [#973](https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/issues/973): Removed support for the DSA (aka DSS) key algorithm, as it has been badly outdated and insecure for a decade or more at this point, and was recently completely removed from OpenSSH as well.
> If you were still using DSA out of sheer inertia: we strongly recommend upgrading to Ed25519 (or maybe ECDSA).

Corresponding error message:
```
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.11/site-packages/sshtunnel.py", line 1093, in get_keys

    'dsa': paramiko.DSSKey,

           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

AttributeError: module 'paramiko' has no attribute 'DSSKey'
```

issue.title: remove DSSKey, which is no longer supported by paramiko
issue.body:
This PR resolves #299 by removing support for paramiko.DSSKey since it is no longer supported by Paramiko:
> [Support] https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/issues/973: Removed support for the DSA (aka DSS) key algorithm, as it has been badly outdated and insecure for a decade or more at this point, and was recently completely removed from OpenSSH as well.
If you were still using DSA out of sheer inertia: we strongly recommend upgrading to Ed25519 (or maybe ECDSA).

issue.title: pyez does not support latest release of paramiko 4.00

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

issue.body:
pyez does not support latest release of paramiko 4.00 due to removal of DSS key support (https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/issues/973)

 Connection Error: ConnectError(host: x.x.x.x, msg: module 'paramiko' has no attribute 'DSSKey')

issue.title: ncclient support for Paramiko v4.0.0 (DSA Key deprication)
issue.body:
Paramiko v4.0.0 was released on **2025-Aug-03** - [https://www.paramiko.org/changelog.html](https://www.paramiko.org/changelog.html)

According to the release notes, support as been removed for the DSA (aka DSS) key algorithm, citing that it is out-of-date/insecure.

Further information regarding Paramiko removal of DSA keys can be seen [here](https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/issues/973).

Code within `ncclient` currently makes references to `paramiko.DSSKey` keys algorithms, which cause crash scenario's to occur, as this key type has been removed from Paramiko v4.0.0.

See following code section in `ncclient/transport/ssh.py` file as an example.

```
if hostkey_b64:
    # If we need to connect with a specific hostkey, negotiate for only its type
    hostkey_obj = None
    for key_cls in [paramiko.DSSKey, paramiko.Ed25519Key, paramiko.RSAKey, paramiko.ECDSAKey]:  <<-- Reference to DSSKey
        try:
            hostkey_obj = key_cls(data=base64.b64decode(hostkey_b64))
        except paramiko.SSHException:
            # Not a key of this type - try the next
            pass
```

Pre 4.0.0 releases of Paramiko do not have this issue.

Would it be possible for `ncclient` to be updated to support Paramiko v4.0.0 by removing support for DSA (DSS) keys?

issue.title: [FIX] storage_backend_sftp: Set paramiko version < 4.0.0 to ensure compatibility

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
On Aug4 a new version of Paramiko was released, which is not compatible with storage_backend_sftp.

https://pypi.org/project/paramiko/#history

Issue: 

ImportError: cannot import name 'DSSKey' from 'paramiko' 

Pinning the version to <4.0.0 should fix the issue for now, until someone took a closer look at the compatibly issue.
